artist: Artist: Tsukioka Yoshitoshi; Publisher: Masadaya Heikichi
catalogue_raissonne: Keyes, Courage and Silence (1982), no. 280.7; Iwakiri, Yoshitoshi (2014), fig. 89, p. 284.
creditline: The Mary Griggs Burke Endowment Fund established by the Mary Livingston Griggs and Mary Griggs Burke Foundation, gifts of various donors, by exchange, and gift of Edmond Freis in memory of his parents, Rose and Leon Freis
description: one sheet; bare breasted woman with long hair wearing a tattered khaki robe, reaching under the arms of a boy with thick hair and red skin; rabbit to left of figures; woman leaning against a blooming cherry tree; green mountain in distance
markings: Artist’s seal: 魁 {Kai} | Censor seal: 酉弐
medium: Woodblock print (nishiki-e); ink and color on paper
portfolio: From Essays by Yoshitoshi (Ikkai zuihitsu 一魁随筆)
signed: 一魁斎芳年筆 {Ikkaisai Yoshitoshi hitsu}
title: Yamauba and Kaidomaru
